entry.et: Middle English towaille, from Anglo-French tuaille, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German dwahila towel; akin to Old High German dwahan to wash

def.dt: :an absorbent cloth or paper for wiping or drying
:to rub or dry (as the body) with a towel
:to use a towel to dry oneself toweled down after swimming
:a very large usually brightly colored towel designed for use at the beach
:an endless towel hung from a roller
:a towel made of cotton terry cloth
:to add as a gratuity or supplement
:to introduce or interject in the course of something :contribute they throw in some … sound effects on several songs Tom Phillips
:to enter into association or partnership :join agrees to throw in with a crooked ex-cop Newsweek
:to abandon a struggle or contest :acknowledge defeat :give up
